citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
During the inspection within the goat exhibition area, a white with tan/gray markings, adult, female domestic goat was
observed to have her right eye completely crusted shut. The goat was unable to open her right eye and there was dried
yellow discharge under the eye adhered to the skin. The facility representatives were unaware of the abnormal eye
condition until pointed out by the inspector. The attending veterinarian had not been notified of the abnormal condition of
the goat and veterinary care has not been provided to evaluate the goat's eye. Daily observation of all animals shall be
made to assess their health and well-being and promptly identify injuries, disease, and other medical conditions.
Untreated injuries, infections, and other conditions can be painful and cause suffering to the animal. The female goat must
be evaluated by a veterinarian and any prescribed treatments and care must be followed. *Note: Prior to the exit
interview, a facility representative contacted the attending veterinarian (AV) and a treatment plan was determined.
***To be corrected by: 5:00pm CST on 10/30/24.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3)  Direct
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
During the inspection within the goat exhibition area, a white with tan/gray markings, adult, female domestic goat was 
observed to have her right eye completely crusted shut. The goat was unable to open her right eye and there was dried 
yellow discharge under the eye adhered to the skin. The facility representatives were unaware of the abnormal eye 
condition until pointed out by the inspector. The attending veterinarian had not been notified of the abnormal condition of 
the goat and veterinary care has not been provided to evaluate the goat's eye. Daily observation of all animals shall be 
made to assess their health and well-being and promptly identify injuries, disease, and other medical conditions. 
Untreated injuries, infections, and other conditions can be painful and cause suffering to the animal. The female goat must 
be evaluated by a veterinarian and any prescribed treatments and care must be followed. *Note: Prior to the exit 
interview, a facility representative contacted the attending veterinarian (AV) and a treatment plan was determined.  
 
***To be corrected by: 5:00pm CST on 10/30/24. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
